cleaned_text: Homeopathy, or homeopathic medicine, is a form of complementary and alternative medicine that claims to accelerate a healing response of the body and strengthens the ability of the body to heal itself. Practicing homeopathic medicine includes use of tiny amounts of natural substances such as plants and minerals. [Homeopathy ](https://www.reportsanddata.com/report-detail/homeopathy-market)is a therapeutic method that usually uses highly diluted preparations of raw materials which have the ability to correspond to manifestations of the disorders. The substances used are called remedies and usually consist of dilutions of plants or animal extracts. The system was developed in Germany more than 200 years and is based on unconventional theories including "like cures like" and "law of minimum dose". Homeopathic products are often made as [sugar](https://www.reportsanddata.com/report-detail/sugar-substitutes-market) pellets to be placed under the tongue but are also available in other forms such as ointments, gels, drops, creams, and tablets. The FDA regulates homeopathic remedies but unlike traditional medicines, these are not regulated for efficacy and safety. Homeopathy is a safe and effective tool that can be seamlessly integrated into a practicing clinician's approaches as either first-line therapy or adjunctive treatment. It is relatively free of adverse side effects, is curative in some diseases, speeds up healing in adjunctive therapies, enhances body's ability to restore balance, and is relatively inexpensive as compared to modern medicine. Homeopathy has developed across various countries in the world and is now widely accepted as a credible therapy and several companies across the globe are investing heavily in extensive R&D activities to develop robust homeopathic medicines and products to cater to growing global demand.
